trans-unit.source: Represents the data in a SOAP request received or a SOAP response sent by an XML Web service method at a specific <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage"></xref>.
This class cannot be inherited.
Gets the SOAPAction HTTP request header field for the SOAP request or SOAP response.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage.Action%2A> property can be accessed during any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
The SOAPAction HTTP request header field for the SOAP request or SOAP response.
Gets a representation of the method prototype for the XML Web service method for which the SOAP request is intended.

Although the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage.MethodInfo%2A> property can be accessed during any stage, the method information is only available during <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize> and <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize>.
A <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.LogicalMethodInfo"></xref> representing the XML Web service method for which the SOAP request is intended.
Gets a value indicating whether the client waits for the server to finish processing an XML Web service method.

A <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentMethodAttribute> or <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapRpcMethodAttribute> applied to an XML Web service method or XML Web service client can specify whether the XML Web service method is one way or not by setting the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentMethodAttribute.OneWay%2A> property of the attribute.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage.OneWay%2A> property can be accessed during any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
`true` if the client waits for the server to completely process a method; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the instance of the class handling the method invocation on the Web server.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage.Server%2A> property is an instance of the class implementing the XML Web service.

If a SOAP extension knew ahead of time the type of the class, it could cast <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage.Server%2A> to that type and access properties and methods of the class implementing the XML Web service.

The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage.Server%2A> property can be accessed during <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize> or <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize>.
The instance of the class implementing the XML Web service.

<xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage"></xref> is not <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize"></xref> or <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize"></xref>.
Gets the version of the SOAP protocol used to communicate with the XML Web service.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage.SoapVersion%2A> property is guaranteed to be valid after the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeDeserialize> stage.

In the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeDeserialize> stage the property is available, but the SOAP message has not been completely processed and SOAP extensions that may alter the contents of the SOAP message have not run.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapProtocolVersion"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapProtocolVersion.Default"></xref>.
Gets the base URL of the XML Web service.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage.Url%2A> property can be accessed during any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
The base URL of the XML Web service.
